newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine sugar beet harvest at 17.32 mln T so far.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine sugar beet harvest at 17.32 mln T so far.

text.p: Ukraine has harvested 17.32 million tonnes of sugar beets, down from 24.42 million tonnes at this time last year, an Agriculture Ministry official said on Tuesday.
Valentyn Tymoshenko, deputy head of the ministry's crop department, told Reuters that sugar beet yields were down to 19.6 tonnes per hectare from 22.0 tonnes per hectare in 1995.
This year's harvest started later to allow beets to mature and so far 882,000 hectares have been harvested compared to 1.11 million hectares at this time last year.
The deputy head of the state's Weather Forecasting Centre predicted favourable weather conditions through October, but said night frosts could hit the north at the end of the month.
"We hope the dry weather which we are expecting through October will help our farmers collect the rest of the sugar beet harvest," Anatoly Prokopenko said.
Ukraine's beet harvest started two weeks later this year due to drought in the early part of the growing season and there are concerns that early frosts could endanger the crop.
The Agriculture Ministry has forecast total sugar beet output at a poor 26 million tonnes compared to 30 million tonnes in 1995.
Ukraine intends to produce about 3.20 million tonnes of refined sugar from this year's harvest, compared to last year's 3.49 million tonnes.
